description: You have been given $ n $ distinct integers $ a_{1},a_{2},...,a_{n} $ . You can remove at most $ k $ of them. Find the minimum modular $ m $ $ (m>0) $ , so that for every pair of the remaining integers $ (a_{i},a_{j}) $ , the following unequality holds: ![](https://cdn.luogu.com.cn/upload/vjudge_pic/CF303C/e08769ae8f052f7d357ba6c3db7e7cd896370f65.png).
inputFormat:
The first line contains two integers $ n $ and $ k $ ( $ 1<=n<=5000,0<=k<=4 $ ), which we have mentioned above.

The second line contains $ n $ distinct integers $ a_{1},a_{2},...,a_{n} $ $ (0<=a_{i}<=10^{6}) $ .
outputFormat: Print a single positive integer — the minimum $ m $ .
translation:
给出 $ n $ 和 $ n $ 个正整数 $ a_1 ,a_2 ,\ ...\ ,a_n $

你最多可以删除其中 $ k $ 个数字，求出一个最小的 $ m $ ，使剩下的数字模 $ m $ 后的值互不相同
